revised_title: Topographical Relationship between Soma Position and Fibre Trajectory in Xenopus Mesencephalic Trigeminal Nucleus
tldr: The study examines the relationship between the position of soma and fibre trajectory of neurons in the mesencephalic trigeminal nucleus of Xenopus laevis. It found a topographical relationship between the two, with the trajectory of a fibre depending on the mediolateral position of its cell body within the nucleus. The researchers propose a hypothesis based on the development of the tectum in Xenopus and the timing of mes. V cell production to explain this relationship.
